name: Inn At Deep Creek

reviews.text: The rooms are quite nice, high vaulted ceilings with kitchen amentities. The Keurig and K Cups were a nice touch. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Bathroom counter is a little on the small side. Great TV channel selection! Front desk personnel are very friendly and accomodating. There is no fitness center on-site. Laundry facilities are available in the lounge area.
reviews.title: Quaint getaway

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Inn at one of the TAN VIP units. Our expectations were exceeded in many ways. The spacious room was spotless and very comfortable. The wide screen TV had a wide array of movie channels. Our trip was cut short by the bad weather caused by Hurricane Sandy but we had enough time with nice weather to see the beautiful surrounding area. There are plenty of places to eat and shop near by. We plan to go back when we can enjoy the activities this area has to offer.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Relax

reviews.text: I am an old man -half crippled- and just getting over a bout of pneumonia when Sandy struck my home with nearly 4 ft. of snow and I lost power -no power, no heat .my friends called there and
reviews.title: rath of sandy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got the last room available. the Inn was easy to find , right off the main road.on check in the staff
reviews.title: You have to stay here at least once!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: noticed i was in bad shape, and swarmed to help me. one placed me in a chair while the paper work was handled, another grabbed my bag and carried it upstairs and returned to help me up
reviews.title: Wonderful surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But I just didn't. We booked this stay after reading the reviews here. For those thinking of booking, both the positive and negative reviews are accurate, if that makes sense. To further explain, let me give you details.
reviews.title: I wanted to love it here...

reviews.text: In fairness, we did stay here two nights over the holiday, Dec. 23 & Dec. 24, so they likely had part-time people on duty.
reviews.title: a trip to the mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good news: we stayed in the king studio and were very impressed with the size of the room and the cleanliness. We also loved the public areas, beautifully decorated with trees and leather chairs and couches.
reviews.title: Okay but expected better

reviews.text: Personally, we found the breakfast sandwiches, coffee and juices plentiful and a nice treat. This is NOT a B&b, so we were pleased with the perk.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: The resort was also fairly quiet though there were a good number of young families there.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: We had a girl's week stay at the Inn at Deep Creek and everyone of us were pleasantly thrilled with our choice of accomodations. The Inn at Deep Creek was immaculately clean and the entire staff could not have been more informative for our needs.
reviews.title: Felt like HOME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sherri, Sharon, Amy, Meghan, Christy....to mention some of them were there around the clock for our needs and suggesting great places to hang out or to go eat and relax. I HIGHLY suggest everyone check this place out you feel like your at home and you dont want to leave, we didnt want to leave at all. GREAT JOB to all of you.
reviews.title: Wonderful Spur of the Moment Get-away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd decided just that morning to make a spur of the moment trip for our anniversary. We got the room with the best view and a fireplace. Plus there was a small kitchen area and a dvd player for while we enjoyed our fire. (It was practically a little single-room apartment that I think we could actually live in for a while!) The staff was super friendly, always responding quickly and kindly when we asked for extras. I'd come back here for sure -- it's a unique find with it's huge decks outside the rooms!
reviews.title: GREAT TIME IN DEEP CREEK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 17 days at the INN AT DEEP CREEK from 8-17 thru 9-2. The Inn At Deep Creek is a unique place. The area has so many activities& restaurants in a short distance of the inn. Sheri and staff were so helpful and kind in giving us informatiom about anything we ask and I always have lots of questions about everything. The housekeeping staff do a wonderful job,our suite was spotless and updated with a full kitchen & small patio overlooking the lake. The landscaping was beautiful with lovely flowers,hanging baskets and beauitiful planters. The Inn has two very nice common areas with fireplaces,flat screen tv anc comfortable leather couches and chairs to enjoy. Each morning around 7 am coffee&tea are provided alond with packaged breakfast foods &yogurt on some days.Out by the pool area is a very nice grilling/patio area with gas and charcol grills,also a fire pit and very nice tabels and chairs which maker the grilling enjoyable. The Inn also has grilling utilties. Thanks again to Sheri & staff for all your hospitality& kindness. We have been able to travel a lot and have never been to an area with so many activites& and excellent places to eat and drink. Our favorite was Dutch's at Silver Tree,which was one of the best meals we have ever enjoyed in a beautiful setting on the lake.Mountain State Brewing Company had excellent wood fired pizza and salads in a hillside setting. Be sure to dine outside, very affordable.The Long Branch Saloon which is about 8 miles away is a neat drive through the country.Their specialty is beef and on friday& saturday the serve prime rib which was excellent.Another place we loved was J G'S pub great bar food and only i mile from Inn. We loved happy hour at the Santa Fe Grill for margarita's and their beef and chicken nachos are delicious and very inexpensive at happy hour. The Santa Fe is a neat place,again eat outside.Right next door to the Inn is the Honi Honi bar which is on the water.whate a fun place. Live bands on thur,fri,sat,and sundays go and have a blast.Did not like food at Uno's which adjoins the honi food was way over priced for the quality. Other places we liked were Black Bear , Boadwalk wright on the water.For other places talk to Sheri. Deep Creek lake is a beautiful lake you must rent a boat for a day. Some of the holmes on the lake are breathtaking,which you can only see by boat. There are three stste parks with in 5 miles. Our favorite was Swollow Falls with Muddy Creek and upper and lower Swollow Falls.This is a must see. There is also 3 differant places to go horseback riding.Another fun place is Wisp Mountain Ski Area which has the following things to do ,mountain coaster,zip lining,mountain biking,segways,ATV,rock climbing. all of this for all ages. Great place for family fun.Saved the favorite for last .My wife and I are 62 years old andthis was an alsome experience. The white water rafting at Adventure Sports the largest man made mountain top white rafting in the world You experience class 3-4 rapids in a controled enviorment must safer than on a river, what fun it was.I enjoyed it more than river rafting.Even if you decide this is not your cup of tea you must go watch .You can view the course and watchand the view on top of the mountain is spectacular.There is also several white water rafting companys to take you dowm the Youghiogheny river.I hope you understand why we had such a fantastic time.
reviews.title: Another Good Mini Vacation

reviews.text: We were pleased with our stay 2nd time around. We stayed in the rear of the hotel again and love the new dividers btw. each room and also the new patio set; the dividers give a little privacy btw. each room. We also used the water hose to bath our yellow lab & the free washer & dryer to wash the dog's towels afterward. The grab n go breakfast option (package pastries) were good to - McDonald & mini grocery store within walking distance if hungry. Room was clean but need a little more light (watts). Definitely will return next year.
reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable

reviews.text: Deep Creek weekend:
reviews.title: Wisp weekend at Inn at Deep Creek

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family ( wife and two daughters) planned a long weekend to ski at Wisp Resort in the Deep Creek Lake area of MD. My wife and I both have vacationed in Deep Creek over the years (in both summer and winter seasons), but this was the first time in many years and for our girls, ages eight and 11. Since this was a ski trip, I explored a few lodging options at Wisp, including some of the rental town homes on the mountain, but decided to keep the lodging cost for a three day/two night stay under $500. I settled on the Inn at Deep Creek which is about five miles from the ski resort. Its in a good location near the lake, restaurants, the state park, etc.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: The Inn is rustic at first glance. In a different geography, the Inn is an average motel with a lakeside view. I'm sure the charm of the place most likely radiates better in the summer months with its proximity to the lake, but it's a little underwhelming when the sun goes down before 5pm as it does in winter The front desk is staffed by very friendly family members or in-laws ( I assumed they were related in some way when one of the staff said she lived in one of the rooms). There is a pleasant lounge area that runs the length of the first floor and within it are board games, books, a fireplace, comfy sofas and chairs, a computer desk and a snack table that is stocked with coffee and danishes in the morning. Other amenities include free wifi (nice) and loaner ipads(no fee). And I believe there's a small pool and outdoor amenities including grills and a boat dock that you would use in the summer.
reviews.title: Great for week long or overnight getaway.

reviews.text: As for the room, I have to start with the fact that it wasn't ready when we arrived. We drove up from three hours away that morning, spent a few hours at Wisp and arrived around 2:30pm. This appeared to be the time they started to make our room ready and the desk clerk said it would be an hour. We went to a nearby Pizzario Uno's and returned around 3:40 and still waited another 15-20 minutes. It was Saturday, but The Inn was hardly packed with people and considering most of their guests are driving in from another destination, the delay was a mild annoyance. Our room was on the first floor which meant we could walk right out into the lounge area; in a sense, access to the lounge expands your room size, but, of course, the space is shared with any other guests around. The room itself was as described on the web site. A king bed with a sleeper sofa, kitchenette with microwave, full size stove and refrigerator and a nice size table for eating which is good when traveling with kids. The room was a good size overall ( we usually try to stay in suites when traveling with the kids), but the our bathroom was too small and in need of some serious upgrading. I was surprised to read in their brochure that there had been a remodel in 2010; not in the bathroom apparently. The floors are also a bit thin, so be mindful of walking/stomping above you if on the ground floor. The Inn is also pet friendly, so random barking was part of our experience when its owners left the dog behind for the evening. Our kids loved the sleeper sofa's foam mattress, so that was a plus. The the furniture was in good shape and the room had plenty of lamps, but there was a dimness to our space; the room was not bright in the evenings. Finally, the heat/ac unit was right next to the bed and blew warm air directly onto/across the head of the bed. There did not appear to be a way to turn the vents in a different direction to avoid air blowing into your face while sleeping.
reviews.title: Solid choice for Family Ski weekend

reviews.text: Mainly, the service at the Inn was satisfactory, but the appearance of not being prepared for our arrival was a gap. Another is that there is a prominently displayed envelope for tipping the maid in the room, but we never had any kind of cleaning happen in the room since the initial check-in; no one came to empty the trashcans over the two evenings there nor restock any kitchen and bath supplies. My wife stayed in the second day and asked for service twice with no results, though she did get extra towels. But they never took the used ones???
reviews.title: Great place to stay

description: Other hotel features include a large lakeside grilling area with picnic tables and grills, a large outdoor heated pool (available May through September), a private beach with boat slip (seasonal day use), and a 2nd-floor community balcony with gorgeous views.
